review_preview: Have tried all the Indian restaurants in Madrid. It is not easy to find good Indian food in Madrid, with attentive staff and a comfortable environment. We found Purnima to be a lovely place to enjoy a relaxing meal with family. Food was lovely. If...
review_full: Have tried all the Indian restaurants in Madrid. It is not easy to find good Indian food in Madrid, with attentive staff and a comfortable environment. We found Purnima to be a lovely place to enjoy a relaxing meal with family. Food was lovely. If you like spice, the Chicken Vindaloo should be spicy enough for most. The Chana masala is by far my favourite. The samosas were scrumptious. We liked all the appetizers, all the main dishes, drinks and the deserts. The staff were all friendly and we sat by the large front window and felt very comfortable there. A wonderful celebration spot. We will be back again.  Thank you!

title_review: Must Stop Place for Beer Enthusiasts
review_preview: Of all the tour books I saw, none mentioned this 25+ year old establishment that had the best beer selection in Centro Madrid.  I saw it by chance while taking the city tour bus - and then it was only because there was a sign...
review_full: Of all the tour books I saw, none mentioned this 25+ year old establishment that had the best beer selection in Centro Madrid. I saw it by chance while taking the city tour bus - and then it was only because there was a sign for Duff Beer (Homer Simpson's favorite) in the window!  Skip the Duff (which is way overpriced and meant to draw in stupid Americans like me), the St. Augustin Grand Cru for 4 and a half Euro with tapas is an outstanding value compared to some of the area restaurants. There were several choices on tap, include Trappist, and I saw many people order food - and everything looked great - but I can only vouch for the tapas. A picture is worth a 1,000 words here - if you are a beer enthusiast, you will feel right at home.

review_preview: Great little pub/bar which is only a short walk away from the royal palace. Really friendly staff who are quick and attentive and make it easy to stay for a good couple of hours, which is what happened to us.As others have said, there...
review_full: Great little pub/bar which is only a short walk away from the royal palace.  Really friendly staff who are quick and attentive and make it easy to stay for a good couple of hours, which is what happened to us. As others have said, there is a huge menu with alot of beers. Ranging from all over the world with different percentages. The decor also shows this to be the case that it takes pride in the beer selection. But if you aren't a beer fan then don't worry as there are plenty of other drinks to choose from. Two ladies with us had a very tasty wine. Also the food is very good, very fresh ingredients and very reasonable prices. It was 4.50 euros for anchovies with olive and peppers on toast, which i ordered and it was very delicious. It also is nice there are a couple of tv's showing the la liga football channel! Definitely one of the best places I relaxed in when visiting Madrid.

review_preview: We went in simply because we were tired, hungry and we loved the window filled with bottle caps. It was a snap decision but we didn't regret it. We immediately loved this place as soon as we set foot in it: it looked cozy, welcoming...
review_full: We went in simply because we were tired, hungry and we loved the window filled with bottle caps. It was a snap decision but we didn't regret it. We immediately loved this place as soon as we set foot in it: it looked cozy, welcoming and absolutely beautiful. It was a pretty small place but that just made it feel intimate, with the retro-looking bar monopolising the entire space and setting a romantic, slightly nostalgic tone. We sat at the table closest to the door and ordered our drinks, which came with the tapas and chips typical of most Spanish restaurants. Next I had the paella with black rice and my boyfriend had the BBQ ribs. My paella was really good but my boyfriend's BBQ ribs were out of this world. I had a few bites out of curiosity and I feel like that taste will never leave my memory. I recommend the heck out of them. The price was decent and the waitress was reasonably nice to us - even though she didn't find much amusement in my short bit of trivia, namely that their WiFi password featured my birth year. I mean, I myself found that pretty amusing, but to each their own I suppose. :D

For 30 Euros per person (with no alcohol) can get you a reasonable dish almost anywhere in Madrid. I suggest taking your money elsewhere.

We obviously looked disappointed so they said they’d dress a table in the window of their bar area for us which was so good of them. The food, service and wine were excellent and the vibe was great when the other diners arrived. Lovely ambience too and the window table was a treat for us watching everyone pass by outside. Would highly recommend this to you all....make sure you book though to avoid disappointment.

review_full: We certainly enjoyed our evening at Decadente, less than a block from our hotel. It is a fairly modern restaurant in the old town of Madrid. For some reason that didn't "fit" for us. It was not "Spanish" enough and seemed it would be more appropriately located in Salamanca with all the other "hip" restaurants. This was our fault and it shouldn't have been our choice for our first night in Madrid.  The food, the drinks and the service were all great and you should not take this review as a reason not to dine hear. It is a friendly and warm place with impressive food. Prices are quite moderate. By the way, it has a great bar with wonderful cocktails

Lots of choice and you can make your own burger choosing the size, the meat, how it’s cooked, type of bread roll etc. and they all come with a choice of fries or potatoes, other sides like coleslaw are extra, we just ordered one extra. Presentation was good and we all thought they were some of the best burgers we've had anywhere. We had a bottle of good red wine, a glass of white, a bottle of water and total bill for four was 64 euros, good value.

title_review: Delicious, best Indian in Madrid, great service, wonderful
review_preview: I visited yesterday and the food was lovely. I had the lunch special and it was only 13.5 Euros for an appetizer, main course, a drink and dessert. The place has a terrace and very nice to sit outside and enjoy the summer weather of...
review_full: I visited yesterday and the food was lovely. I had the lunch special and it was only 13.5 Euros for an appetizer, main course, a drink and dessert. The place has a terrace and very nice to sit outside and enjoy the summer weather of Madrid. I had the Tikka chicken and the soup, which were both very tasty. The waiters are Indian and they are polite, attentive and great service. If you want Asian hospitality, this is the place to visit. I also had a chance to talk to the owner Laurance, a very nice person and attentive to client's needs. He offered a free drink and was always checking if the food was made to my satisfaction. I love this place and will continue to visit during my visits to Madrid.  10/10

title_review: Very friendly handled my English well
review_preview: Came here tonight (Aug 2017). The food was delicious and the staff were great.I don't speak Spanish but this was no problem. The staff, especially the lady, could not accommodate me enough.I ordered a chicken Madras, this was not as hot as I...
review_full: Came here tonight (Aug 2017). The food was delicious and the staff were great. I don't speak Spanish but this was no problem. The staff, especially the lady, could not accommodate me enough. I ordered a chicken Madras, this was not as hot as I expected. Coming from the UK spice is high on expectations. I asked for medium hot whereas I should have asked for hot/extra hot to match my tastes. The portions are very large, too much for me, but I was encouraged to take my leftovers away. Would I come back? Yes but I'd ask for extra hot!

review_preview: Almost a year later, I went back to Purnima again, since the place is right next to my friend's place. They have an awesome lunch special for 13.5 Euros, which includes a drink, first plate, second plate and dessert. We sat outside at the terrace,...
review_full: Almost a year later, I went back to Purnima again, since the place is right next to my friend's place. They have an awesome lunch special for 13.5 Euros, which includes a drink, first plate, second plate and dessert. We sat outside at the terrace, which was lovely and decorated with plants. The owner and the staff have done a wonderful job on that. I actually met the owner Delawar and the guy was funny and super friendly. He gave us some free shots and additional drinks while we were there. The service was great too. They have these disciplined Indian workers who come by all the time. They speak multiple languages so if you only know English, that won't be a problem. They will be able to service you.  The food was absolutely delicious. I love eating the creamy curry there. I have also tried the Keema Curry before and that was delicious too. After that curry taste, you can finish off with one of their wonderful ice cream dishes. I like the pistachio ice cream. Yummy! The place gets really busy after 2pm, so if you want some peaceful moment, go a bit earlier and you will definitely find seats.  a must try when you are in Goya! pinchetravels.com for more info on my blog.

title_review: Bad food and racist staff (especially towards Indians).
review_preview: I am so disappointed that we chose this place for a New years eve dinner.We booked through Fork and I called up the restaurant to confirm our reservation. I should have got the hint then itself when the person on phone wasn't able to...
review_full: I am so disappointed that we chose this place for a New years eve dinner. We booked through Fork and I called up the restaurant to confirm our reservation. I should have got the hint then itself when the person on phone wasn't able to give me a clear picture of the fixed menu. But Somehow I didn't and I regret that we did. Except the lady that served us, we didn't feel welcome at all by anyone in the staff including the person who looked like the manager. Here I must say that their behaviour towards non Indians was completely opposite. I could see it from my table how their mannerism changed when they were talking to others. They were more friendly and cordial. With us, they were just loud, rude and curt. To top it all, the food was bad and extremely spicy. I don't remember eating anything which was remotely good. I regret taking my family to this place. Good thing is that we finished in less than 1 hour and went somewhere else to bring in New Years Eve. Pls avoid.

review_preview: Stumbled upon this place one tuesday evening when wifey wanted to reward me with a burger. Ended up being the only place we ate twice during our stay in Madrid. The food is excellent, american style. Like others have mentioned, medium might be what you...
review_full: Stumbled upon this place one tuesday evening when wifey wanted to reward me with a burger. Ended up being the only place we ate twice during our stay in Madrid. The food is excellent, american style. Like others have mentioned, medium might be what you consider rare. Even so I went with rare on our second visit and loved it. It's only as cooked as needs to be, you get what you ask for. The staff is great as well. Even though they're visibly busy (place was packed both times), they're still in a good mood, smiling and laughing. Javier is the only name I got, but he and his co-workers are all very serviceminded and it truly shows. They have options other than burgers too. If you're looking for Something meaty, american style, check this place out.

title_review: A Belgian beer paradise - in Spain!

review_full: We happened upon Cerveceria La Mayor on our way back to our hotel one evening, and what a find it was! It's a small (tiny) bar decorated with beer bottles and memorabilia from around the world, but the really astounding thing is the selection of beer (there seems to be a focus on Belgian) they carry. I tend to make a habit of asking if bars have gluten-free beer and I was pleasantly surprised to be told this one does. Friendly service, and a quite a buzz to the atmosphere - even when it's not heaving as the first time I visited. I have to say, I didn't try the food, but I don't think that's really what this place is about. In any case, there are plenty of reasons to stop off here, even if you're not hungry!

We sat for a fee hours this weekend practicing our Spanish with people who were patient and kept the beer flowing with great recommendations from around the globe. I highly recommend this be one of your stops on any pub crawl you do in Madrid. The ONLY negative is that they aren't open on Sunday.

review_preview: Every time I go somewhere I try at least one burger restaurant. The owner of this chain has understood what makes a tasty burger: the meat! Instead of drowning an overcooked patty of poor quality meat in various sauces, this small chain offer high quality...
review_full: Every time I go somewhere I try at least one burger restaurant. The owner of this chain has understood what makes a tasty burger: the meat! Instead of drowning an overcooked patty of poor quality meat in various sauces, this small chain offer high quality meat that does the job. The burgers tend to be a bit sweet because of the onions. The desserts are also worth trying. The Steakburger restaurants are spread out in Madrid and, from the outside, they all seem to offer the same menu.  All in all: one of the best burgers I have had in a long time.

A little gem of a place and not to be missed if looking for a break from Spanish lager!

title_review: Delicious Indian food and efficient service
review_preview: Although we had made a reservation, when we arrived the greeter was confused and said he did not have a reservation for us. I had to show my confirmation email on my phone to convince him. We were accommodated downstairs at a small table and...
review_full: Although we had made a reservation, when we arrived the greeter was confused and said he did not have a reservation for us. I had to show my confirmation email on my phone to convince him.  We were accommodated downstairs at a small table and very small seats. I'm sure even slightly overweight people would not fit! The seats reminded me of kindergarten kids' chairs.  The food was really delicious and the naans were perfectly cooked without any charring. My naan was stuffed with dry fruits. Chole and paneer dishes were cooked to perfection. Service was very good. With generous quantity we ended up with taking away food to go and did not try any desserts. We met the chef who is from Jalendar and told him how great the food was.  I recommend this place for Indian food in Madrid.

I also ordered their speciality juice containing carrot, orange and lemon which was a fantastic complement to the paella. They really care about giving their customers a great experience, which shows in their service and their food. I highly recommend visiting their restaurant when you are in Madrid!

review_preview: I booked this restaurant using the Fork through trip adviser. This was a very simple system and worked well. The restaurant was amazing. It is one of the best Indians I have ever had. The staff were very helpful when ordering and recommended just one...
review_full: I booked this restaurant using the Fork through trip adviser. This was a very simple system and worked well.  The restaurant was amazing. It is one of the best Indians I have ever had. The staff were very helpful when ordering and recommended just one starter to share. We went for onion bhajis which were delicious and just the right amount for 2 of us.  For mains I went for chicken jalfrezi which was delicious. The waitress asked what spice I would like and recommended mild and it was just right. The curries are usually slightly hotter than what we would get in England. My partner went for chicken tikka masala and really enjoyed it. We only went for one rice and one naan to share between us as this was recommended and this turned out to be a perfect sized portion. The rice was huge and we didn’t eat it all between us.  One member of staff turned out to be from our home town so it was nice to talk to him.  Overall this is a lovely restaurant with great food and great staff.  It is just around the corner from the Wizink Center.

title_review: Indian While in Spain?  Why Not?!
review_preview: We have a very hard time passing up Indian food regardless of where we are in the world.  Purnima did not disappoint.  We got a chicken curry and a vegetable kurma along with some onion and Peshwari naan.  The food was all great and the...
review_full: We have a very hard time passing up Indian food regardless of where we are in the world. Purnima did not disappoint. We got a chicken curry and a vegetable kurma along with some onion and Peshwari naan. The food was all great and the flavors were out of this world as well. The only thing that surprised me as is that we had to order and pay for a single bowl of white rice. We have never had to do that before...it has always come with our meals. Regardless, it didn't break any deals...it was still worth it and worth a visit if you are looking for some good Indian food in the area.

review_full: We found this cafe by reading reviews. It is tucked away on a side street. Although they have a large menu featuring cereal and brunch items we went here for dinner and we were not disappointed. We ordered the Real Talent Salad which was an excellent side salad to go with a meal. Also had the avocado and salmon toast which was delicious. The star dish was the vegetable paella, it was authentic and delicious, very flavorful. Menu is in English and the owner speaks English as well and made us feel very welcome. They open back up at 7 pm for dinner. Definitely, would recommend and would go back if we were in Madrid longer.

review_preview: The food is good, as is the service. Chicken vindaloo was hot (probably a bit milder than UK version but not bland Spanish rubbish) & apparently the chicken tandoori was lovely. I would definitely go again when next in Madrid. Only slight negative is the...
review_full: The food is good, as is the service. Chicken vindaloo was hot (probably a bit milder than UK version but not bland Spanish rubbish) & apparently the chicken tandoori was lovely. I would definitely go again when next in Madrid. Only slight negative is the price e.g. almost 7 euros for the pilau rice, & 4 euros for a small (300cl) Cobra beer. These prices may well be representative for Indian food in Madrid but still a bit steep in my opinion (comparing to UK). A 10 minute walk from Goya metro, with some other places to drop into for a beer before or after.

review_preview: We expected an excellent service and a good meal based on the numerous reviews on Google Maps and TripAdvisor, but any expectations we had were surpassed to say the least.Although some might consider the interior to be on the quirkier side of the spectrum...
review_full: We expected an excellent service and a good meal based on the numerous reviews on Google Maps and TripAdvisor, but any expectations we had were surpassed to say the least. Although some might consider the interior to be on the quirkier side of the spectrum (especially the cereal room - as we now know, there's a story associated with it, but you'll have to visit to hear it), we ourselves found it adorable and really cosy.  The owner immediately made us feel at home and kept us entertained through the evening with a friendly chat about the restaurant's history, food and the local area.  Both the dishes we had (Spanish omelet and arroz negra) were amazing - the seafood for paella is indeed very fresh and the taste is to die for.  Pricing is very reasonable, especially considering the location.  We will definitely come back and will be recommending Real Talent to all our friends.  ¡Muchas gracias!

review_preview: Steakburger makes a good burger, but they seem to have a different understanding of how much to cook the meat than Americans have. We ordered our two "shy/timido" 1/3 lb burgers medium, but they came out somewhere between medium-rare to rare. There was meat inside...
review_full: Steakburger makes a good burger, but they seem to have a different understanding of how much to cook the meat than Americans have. We ordered our two "shy/timido" 1/3 lb burgers medium, but they came out somewhere between medium-rare to rare. There was meat inside which was barely warmed, with no sign of cooking. Other than that, service was good and the French fries were very good. Ketchup, brown mustard, and mayo were on the table. Coke Zero was served from a glass bottle into glasses with lemon and ice. The interior could almost have been transplanted from the USA, in terms of table size, spacing, and decor. The downstairs seating area had an unpleasant smell which seemed to come from the restrooms; I would have left if that was the only available seating. Overall, a good place to eat American food if you order well.

review_preview: As a family of four we visited this restaurant as it was close to our hotel.  It was very busy mid week so suggest booking at weekends. The staff were busy but efficient. We ordered the nachos to share for starters which were very good...
review_full: As a family of four we visited this restaurant as it was close to our hotel. It was very busy mid week so suggest booking at weekends. The staff were busy but efficient. We ordered the nachos to share for starters which were very good and each ordered a burger with fries for mains. Being British we don’t like uncooked burgers so opted to have them well done. But unfortunately they were very well done and a bit dry, so medium to well would have been much better. They were still tasty, we ordered the tikka masala burger, the Philadelphia burger and the British burger with the fried egg. The children shared the chocolate brownie, which they enjoyed. Less than €90 for 1 starter, 4 mains, 1 dessert, bottle of House red and 4 soft drinks was very reasonable for Madrid.

When we went to pay for the meal we were owed £8 change, the staff assumed this was a tip, but why would we tip when we were served raw food and laughed at? so we asked for our change and the other manager said " this is a tip" and wasn't happy that we asked for it back and when we did get it back we were still short changed.  Overall wasn't really impressed which is a shame because we were really looking forward to dinning here.

title_review: Good Concept, need to improve on the execution
review_preview: Being a Burger's fan and having one evening free during my trip in Madrid, decided to stop at Steakburger due to the good reviews. The deco and atmosphere of the place are really good, waiters are really nice and friendly. I ordered a shrimp salad...
review_full: Being a Burger's fan and having one evening free during my trip in Madrid, decided to stop at Steakburger due to the good reviews. The deco and atmosphere of the place are really good, waiters are really nice and friendly. I ordered a shrimp salad and a burger. Great thing in the concept is you can decide either beef or ox for the patty, choose the size of it, choose the bread and the side dish: Perfect Burger concept. The presentation of the salad was really good, however too much sauce: a Thai sauce quite sweet, sadly too sweet as too much sauce.  The burger presentation was also really good, however I asked for rare and the burger was cold in the middle: For a burger joint, they should know how to cook it perfectly. The french fries were crispy but too oily. All in all ok place but room for improvement on the execution.

review_preview: So many of the reviews touch on the beer, on other items, but I had an interesting experience here for a different reason.  Yes, beer selection was good.  Yes, service was good.  But the real surprise - after visiting 4 other cities in Spain, and...
review_full: So many of the reviews touch on the beer, on other items, but I had an interesting experience here for a different reason. Yes, beer selection was good. Yes, service was good. But the real surprise - after visiting 4 other cities in Spain, and many more reviewed and talked about Paella restaurants, this was the best Paella we had. It's counter-intuitive, but for some reason, these guys had the best shellfish, and the right flavors of spices in the rice to complement the meat. We definitely had to wait a while to get our Paella, but it looked like they took a lot of care to make sure it was good. My compliments to the chef.

review_preview: As a fan of Belgian beers, I was very excited to see the different beers they had in their window display. The place is small and from the outside, it looked like it was packed. We took a chance to find a couple seats at...
review_full: As a fan of Belgian beers, I was very excited to see the different beers they had in their window display. The place is small and from the outside, it looked like it was packed. We took a chance to find a couple seats at the bar but there was a free table instead. This was dinner time also and it looked like there were only 2 people working. But the woman handed us the menu right when we sat down and didn't take long to take our orders. For E24.95, we got 2 drinks (agua, cola, sangria, or beer), a choice between seafood paella or mixed paella, and desserts or cafe, fro 2 people.The sangria was amazing and strong. I had to get another glass. The paella wasn't bad either. I didn't have any beers but that's alright because the sangria made up for it. It was a bit cramp and taberna-esque, which gave it that divey feel. Great find!

review_preview: Machiavelli would love their sneaky pricing. They put a signboard outside advertising a set menu brunch for 14 euros. You order and eat then comes a bill for 17 euros. They bring out the menu and show the tiny little print saying their "mini-brunch" is...
review_full: Machiavelli would love their sneaky pricing. They put a signboard outside advertising a set menu brunch for 14 euros. You order and eat then comes a bill for 17 euros. They bring out the menu and show the tiny little print saying their "mini-brunch" is 14 euros. And the larger brunch is 17 euros. But the signboard says nothing about MINI-brunch. Basically, it's a sneaky way to cheat tourists out of 3 euros. Did not see any Spanish people eating there while I was there. It's a shame because the food was quite good, the service prompt, and included a large fresh blend of juices. However, most of the brunch is cheap stuff like bread, eggs, lettuce, and coffee. I advise avoiding this joint until they quit with the misleading pricing games.

review_preview: After 16 days in Spain, Bar Campanilla was the perfect end to our trip.  The menu includes mostly typical Spanish foods, but Pepe (and his wife?) are perfect hosts.  They made us laugh and treated us like royalty.   Pepe demonstrates tableside how to make Sangria...
review_full: After 16 days in Spain, Bar Campanilla was the perfect end to our trip. The menu includes mostly typical Spanish foods, but Pepe (and his wife?) are perfect hosts. They made us laugh and treated us like royalty. Pepe demonstrates tableside how to make Sangria and makes suggestions for ordering for the table. Fried seafood platters and Sausage platters seem to be the specialty here and both were very good. Personally, I really liked the goat cheese, raisin, date, and walnut salad. At the end of our meal, they brought us complementary truffles and Pepe gave all of the boys Madrid/spain caps. I am not sure how he does all this and make money. Our huge meal including Sangria was only 48 euros for five persons. I am sure I would have paid this for the hats alone in Madrid!

review_preview: Delighted to find this excellent restaurant so close to our airport hotel, serving simple food cooked to perfection. There is a menu in English if you need it. We sampled 4 dishes from the tapas menu - all made from fresh ingredients - all delicious....
review_full: Delighted to find this excellent restaurant so close to our airport hotel, serving simple food cooked to perfection. There is a menu in English if you need it. We sampled 4 dishes from the tapas menu - all made from fresh ingredients - all delicious. Especially liked the black sausage and the pork in tomato sauce. The best though was the fish - simply pan fried with home made chips. This very much a family affair and Pepe head of the clan educated us on the ways of Spanish food and drink. He gave us typed instructions on how to make Sangria and a breakdown of the origin & components of all the dishes we chose. All this delivered in a very entertaining "Pepe style". Before we left we were treated to a nightcap of the house - a kinda Baileys with whipped cream and then he gave us a range of presents from cap to key ring. But the best surprise was the final bill. Given what we had had, it all came at a very reasonable low price. Highly recommended.

The food was wonderful and authentic and the owners most congenial. They gave us baseball hats to take home to our grandchildren and took a photo, sent an email shortly thereafter with the photo attached and a lovely message. Do experience this lovely town and especially this restaurant.

title_review: Restaurante "Campanillas" on Ave de Logrono, Barajas
review_preview: Great tapas place near the Madrid airport.  This restaurant isright across the street from the Best Western in Barajas andis one of the best and most reasonable places to sampletraditional Spanish dishes in all of Spain.  What makes itreally special, however,...
review_full: Great tapas place near the Madrid airport. This restaurant is right across the street from the Best Western in Barajas and is one of the best and most reasonable places to sample traditional Spanish dishes in all of Spain. What makes it really special, however, is the friendly and gregarious owner. "Pepe" strives to take special care of his customers and is happy to advise you on the variety of his specialties. While not fluent in English, he is very interested in his foreign patrons and will strive to communicate with you. This is a  "must stop" for anyone arriving or leaving Barajas airport in  Madrid. You will remember the experience! Check out the  page on Facebook (Restaurante Campanillas).

The food we ordered, lamb kadai, shrimp balti, with roti (not on menu) with prawn puri and papad starters, was really outstanding! Having eaten Indian food across the globe, unlike London we did not expect anything extraordinary here, but ordered for "Madras" hot spicy which they said was one less than extra spicy, turned out to be the charm! Excellent food prepared by their Punjabi Chef, and served with Indian beer amidst great ambiance- glittering colorful lamps from Istanbul, surrounding us and hanging from the ceiling. Staff was very attentive, prompt and very friendly. You can't go wrong if you order the level of spice you like. Highly recommended!!

review_preview: We stopped in for lunch during our trip to Madrid, Spain. Despite the wonderful cuisine that Spain offers, we wanted something that felt closer to home. Up until this stop we had had limited success in finding something we could call home. Well look no...
review_full: We stopped in for lunch during our trip to Madrid, Spain. Despite the wonderful cuisine that Spain offers, we wanted something that felt closer to home. Up until this stop we had had limited success in finding something we could call home.  Well look no further because Steakburger is the place to go. We had the BBQ (Beef) Burger while my brother in-law the BBQ (Ox) Burger. Yes, they make burgers out of Ox as well. My wife had the BBQ Ribs which were excellent.  All of this food for a very reasonable price. However, the best part of the meal was the wonderful service given to us by Marcos. Marcos appears to be running the show at this well-run establishment. Great food, great prices, great service and most of great management from Marcos.  It was so good that we decided to go back the same night for dinner. Problem was the restaurant was closing at 12:00 midnight and we arrived at 11:55pm. No problem for Marcos who not only made sure we got some food, he made sure it was very fresh as well. This time we all got the Ribs but Marcos also threw in some dessert (Apple Crumble Pie).  When you’re staying in Madrid and looking for a place with great food, great prices and great service, then go to Steakburger (Preciados) and ask for Marcos.

review_preview: I'm staying at a nearby hotel and wanted a cold beer and some food. I knew I was in the right place because the outdoor seating area was full of locals. This is a modest, non touristy area. Las Campanillas felt very homey. I ordered...
review_full: I'm staying at a nearby hotel and wanted a cold beer and some food. I knew I was in the right place because the outdoor seating area was full of locals. This is a modest, non touristy area. Las Campanillas felt very homey.  I ordered a half serving of calamares. Pepe explained that "the women were eating" and there would be a half hour delay. I took that to mean that the cooks were having their meal break. Fine. I relaxed with a nice Mahou and the olives Pepe brought. A few minutes later he brought a tapa of chorizo on the house. Delicious. The calamares arrived as promised. They didn't have the crunchy coating that we get in the US, but there was a much fresher squid flavor. Just a little lemon juice was all they needed.  This was probably the friendliest place I've been during my ten days in Spain. Pepe was very welcoming, asked where I was from, etc. A very nice vibe all around.

title_review: Without Tripadvisor would've nev.er found it!
review_preview: Thank you everyone for sharing!What people write is really true. First I must say that I just love tapas and places like this. Where people have their heart with it. I ended up staying night next to airport between my two flights and of...
review_full: Thank you everyone for sharing! What people write is really true. First I must say that I just love tapas and places like this. Where people have their heart with it. I ended up staying night next to airport between my two flights and of course seeked (from tripadvisor) what to eat. Found Campanillas! Yes, it's true, you miss it if you do not know it. And even you would know you still think other places "look nicer" or have better entrances or lights in window etc. No. Try it. Do favor to yourself! If you want white table cloth or hate friendly, home made tapas then you might catch some fancy italian or McD somewhere. Otherwise if you are around go there and you find lovely family run tapas bar with attentive service. Owner Pepe has stories to tell. In any language. And if you do not speak spanish (like I don't) it doesn't matter. You will learn, someone will help. Or you just smile and enjoy.  So what did I do there? I stepped in and asked to get dinner - got menu. But turned away from it and told Pepe that he probably knows better what I need. And he did. Served many different things, I think I ate 4 plates (few small, few very big - meatballs was so to say main course, ah so lovely!) and was really full. During all this we were speaking a lot of football, travelling, Pepes history and stuff. People all over have sent photos, post cards ... everything, bar is decorated with memories. He has some fans. Now one more, me. I have a reason to return to Madrid. Don't even have to go far from airport next time!

title_review: Quaint cafe in a blink-and-you-will-miss location
review_preview: I found Real Talent Cafe on TripAdvisor, lured by the positive reviews of the proprietor, the ambiance and setting, and the paella.It took me a subway ride to get here and a meandering walk down some side streets but eventually, I made it. And...
review_full: I found Real Talent Cafe on TripAdvisor, lured by the positive reviews of the proprietor, the ambiance and setting, and the paella. It took me a subway ride to get here and a meandering walk down some side streets but eventually, I made it. And I'm glad I made the trek. The owner was kind and gracious, ready to answer any questions I had about the menu. The cafe is kitschy and bright, small but comfortable, and WiFi is free! I didn't have to wait long for my lunch; the salad was small but delicious, and the vegetable paella hit the spot! And, to top it all off, a slice of carrot cake I just managed to finish. I was so full but I never miss dessert. Anyone looking for a lunch/dinner spot off the beaten path should give Real Talent Cafe a try. It's worth it!

title_review: Best Indian & Best Menu del Dia Madrid
review_preview: Madrid has really surprised me in terms of how many good Indian restaurants there are but Purnima took it to another level. For 13.50 each (a steal) we got a starter, entree, dessert and drink. Every single dish was either good or amazing and we...
review_full: Madrid has really surprised me in terms of how many good Indian restaurants there are but Purnima took it to another level. For 13.50 each (a steal) we got a starter, entree, dessert and drink. Every single dish was either good or amazing and we were pretty stuffed by the end. My favourites were their vegetable pakora, perfect chana masala and both kulfi and mango lassi for dessert. I asked the chana to be spicy and they made it with just the right level of spice. If you're looking for an authentic, vegetarian-friendly and affordable but still nice Indian restaurant in Madrid this is the place to go.

review_full: We were here a couple of weeks ago, on our way to Azores. Pepe made us feel us like very special guests, told us fun stories, kept us company, treated us to some free "tapas" and even gave us a little souvenir of Madrid. We loved his company and the food he served, which was freshly made by his wife. We had Spanish tortilla with green pepper and albondigas, which tasted like the homemade ones I can make, plus a good fresh salad with goat cheese. We felt right at home by old friends and the bill didn't break the bank. We will come back any time we can and we wish Pepe, his family and his business all the best! Muchisimas gracias Pepe!

review_preview: I had booked a table for a large group for 9pm on a Saturday, and in the afternoon, called and asked if we could move it to 9.30pm. The manager said it was not possible as he had another table coming at 10.30pm. I was...
review_full: I had booked a table for a large group for 9pm on a Saturday, and in the afternoon, called and asked if we could move it to 9.30pm. The manager said it was not possible as he had another table coming at 10.30pm. I was surprised we would only be allotted 1.5 hours but he said this was how things were done when you booked online. As we were taking the train in from Toledo, we had to rush to the restaurant and arrived by 9.15pm. The main server seems to be the owner. He was pleasant enough but has a major chip on his shoulder. While he was serving someone at the table a cocktail, a little bit fell into my companion's wine. He said sorry and took away the glass, we assumed he would replace it, but nothing happened. When he saw us talking about this, he brought back the glass saying "oh well if you still want it, here you go." Through the night, he seemed kind of cocky and not helpful when ordering.  Funnily enough, during my trip to Spain, I had at least one waiter drop a drink on the table or on me or on someone at the table each day. Overall, servers aren't very bothered by this so I guess it's something we had to get used to. The food here is quite good, apart from the overuse of nachos in a few dishes, you will be very happy with the quality and portions of the dishes. The flavours are authentic and the sauces they serve on the side, are delicious! The cocktails sound lovely but are all very watered down so apart from the margarita's, stick to the wine (and protect it with your life).  If it weren't for the owner/server's attitude, I would have given this a four-star review. Also, we left the restaurant at 11.30pm and there was no other table waiting, hence we could have easily arrived a little later, more comfortably.

review_preview: I know this is part of a small chain of restaurants, but does not alter the fact that it feels a very personal experience. I am not a person that eats that many burgers because usually eating out they are not that good. This place...
review_full: I know this is part of a small chain of restaurants, but does not alter the fact that it feels a very personal experience. I am not a person that eats that many burgers because usually eating out they are not that good. This place is the exception, only once before have I had anything better. that being in NYC. A great welcome by Javier who took our order & explained the menu, the difference between Beef & Ox. 4 or 5 different weights according to your appetite. and all the different types of garnish. All dishes were served with jacket potatoes or fries + coleslaw. I noticed from the open kitchen that burgers were being hand rolled to order. Ernesto a trainee waiter served our food supervised by the very able & personable Javier. The decor although functional is very interesting, like a lot of shops in Madrid that are very old, they have retained the character of the building very well.  Its always a pleasure when something more than lives up to your expectations & this place did in every way....All for a very fair price too.

After a couple of complimentary tapas, he steered us to the Iberian ham, the baby squid (yummy) and the kebab (wonderfully marinated) plus the garlic potatoes with mayonnaise (best ever?). Just the right amount, too.  Sit outside for a lovely evening. Very friendly service; and, he wants to practice his English, which already pretty good--better than my Spanish. Wish it weren't our last night in Madrid, or we be back again!

title_review: A place you enjoy coming back to
review_preview: We found this place almost by accident.  It was across from the hotel that we were using because of its proximity to the airport.  It's a great spot for breakfast.  For North Americans who are not used to Spanish breakfasts, I would recommend potato tortilla...

For North Americans who are not used to Spanish breakfasts, I would recommend potato tortilla with a chorizo sausage. We also had supper there, supervised and organized by Pepe. What fun, and the food was good, too. This was the friendliest restaurant we encountered on our two month European visit. When we came back the second and third times it was like experiencing the opening scene from Cheers!

review_preview: After reading the reviews of this restaurant we were looking forward to meeting Pepe and we were not disappointed.Forget the food, forget the wine, forget the surroundings, just enjoy the experience.We were fortunate in that we had a friend with us who spoke...
review_full: After reading the reviews of this restaurant we were looking forward to meeting Pepe and we were not disappointed. Forget the food, forget the wine, forget the surroundings, just enjoy the experience. We were fortunate in that we had a friend with us who spoke fluent Spanish so we left the ordering to him though in fact what we were served was decided by Pepe who has some English albeit limited. This is not a high-end restaurant but excels in what our friend described as typical Madrid-style home cooking. Some dishes we loved, one or two not to our taste. The wine was again chosen by Pepe who insisted we try several. Constant visits to our table to chat about rugby, soccer, food, wine, sharing jokes added to the pleasure of the evening. Something very different from the usual restaurant visit. Campanillas is a place where ordinary Spaniards go for home-cooked food, watch football on TV and share a glass of wine or two with friends. It should be approached on that basis. Hopefully you'll be pleasantly surprised. You'll certainly be satisfied with the very modest bill you'll receive at the end of the evening.

title_review: Delicious meal during a quick layover!
review_preview: My husband and I were staying in Madrid for only one night at a hotel across the street, and we decided on having dinner at this restaurant after reading the great reviews. We were craving some delicious Spanish food, and we found it here. We...
review_full: My husband and I were staying in Madrid for only one night at a hotel across the street, and we decided on having dinner at this restaurant after reading the great reviews. We were craving some delicious Spanish food, and we found it here. We sat outside and ordered a pitcher of sangria and the suggested seafood plate and sausage plate. The seafood plate included delicious fried calamari, fish, and anchovies. The sausage was also very flavorful. (Probably too much food for just two people though - I didn't realize the portions would be so generous!) During the meal, they brought us several samples. When we left, Pepe came over and said he had two gifts for us if we visited him behind the bar before leaving. He gave us a Madrid baseball cap and a large Madrid magnet! Very friendly service and great food make this the perfect spot for a relaxing dinner for exhausted travelers!

title_review: Excellent value for money, traditional tasty cooking and very good service
review_preview: We are staying near the airport in Madrid and after having read the other reviews decided to give Campanillas a go. If you are looking for traditional Spanish cooking, friendly service, very good value for money and atmosphere this is the place to go. We...
review_full: We are staying near the airport in Madrid and after having read the other reviews decided to give Campanillas a go. If you are looking for traditional Spanish cooking, friendly service, very good value for money and atmosphere this is the place to go. We had a large mixed tuna salad, "morcilla", (similar to black pudding), calamari and patatas bravas/ali oli. With drinks it came to just over 30€. The food was freshly cooked and of very good quality. The atmosphere was very friendly, there was a mixture of locals, holidaymakers, families and couples. We will definitely go back next time we fly from Barajas.

review_preview: Just arrived in Madrid and while walking in the city we came across Steakburger!We tried Ox meat burger - the most juicy, tasty, high quality burger with thin bread completing the scene! Thin bread being extremely important, as it does not kill the taste...
review_full: Just arrived in Madrid and while walking in the city we came across Steakburger! We tried Ox meat burger - the most juicy, tasty, high quality burger with thin bread completing the scene! Thin bread being extremely important, as it does not kill the taste of the meat! Indeed premium burger! Excellent wine served on the table by the glass, the amount of which was more than generous! Variety of sauces available for the sauce fanatics! The warm atmosphere is evident from the minute one steps in and the staff makes sure to preserve this feeling! Even the wet napkins handed out at the end had an impressive feel and smell, showing the care and love that has been put into this venue! Señor Javier and his colleagues showed us that it’s not only good food that matters but also great service and a big smile!! PS. It was really a spiritual orgasm!  Svetlana & Victor, Limassol, Cyprus

review_preview: The owner, Pepe, has been doing this for 40 years and he still seems to enjoy it as much as ever.  His English is not great, and my Spanish is poor, but with Pepe's help we had a great meal.  We shared a salad and...
review_full: The owner, Pepe, has been doing this for 40 years and he still seems to enjoy it as much as ever. His English is not great, and my Spanish is poor, but with Pepe's help we had a great meal. We shared a salad and the chicken and pork kabobs, all of which was very good. Pepe brought us three kinds of appetizers that were all tasty. I asked him to make us some sangria, so he brought everything to the table and made us a full pitcher (a bargain for 10 euros) that was the best I've ever had. He later threw in some dessert at no extra charge. We will be in Spain for 10 days, and I suspect this will be the best dinner we will have. For all we had the price was about 32 euros, which would be a good deal in the US, and even more so in Europe. If in the area, I would recommend a visit here without reservation. It's not fancy, but it is excellent food for a modest price from one of the nicest owners you could hope to meet.

title_review: Fabulous food and sangria with a healthy side of fun!
review_preview: We were staying across the street and the hotel shuttle driver clued us in to this little pub where the locals eat. Ask for Pepe!  He has a lot of personality and we just let him bring us food (all of it excellent) until we'd...
review_full: We were staying across the street and the hotel shuttle driver clued us in to this little pub where the locals eat. Ask for Pepe! He has a lot of personality and we just let him bring us food (all of it excellent) until we'd had enough. He did ask if there were any dietary restrictions, which for us was not an issue, but it is good to know he was thinking of the possibility. Come early (Spanish early = 9) as the place fills up with locals. We had a small pitcher of sangria (made fresh at our table) and a few combo platters of traditional pub food: calamari, croquetas, fries (with garlic aioli and 'spicy' sauce), tortilla de patata, meatballs, mussels, jamon, oh and for dessert a few lovely little homemade truffles of chocolate heaven.  Enjoy the ambiance and the chance to be Spanish for an evening- don't rush it! The food is worth every minute! If you happen to have a cap or tchotchke from your city to donate to their wall, they may even display it. Sadly our city was not yet represented, but we'll be sure to bring something next time we come!!

review_preview: Visiting the Campanillas was an absolutely right choice.  We only had the evening in Madrid between flights and didn't want to waste it.  We found this place on Trip Advisor and realized it was 600 meters from our hotel near the airport.  Too tired to...
review_full: Visiting the Campanillas was an absolutely right choice. We only had the evening in Madrid between flights and didn't want to waste it. We found this place on Trip Advisor and realized it was 600 meters from our hotel near the airport. Too tired to go across town we gave it a shot and walked down the street. At first we weren't sure it was even open but we had just come so early - our body clocks were out of synch with local time and we were hungry by 6:15pm. Met Pepe as we entered and sat at a very nice little home-spun dining room with red checked table cloths. My were were we in for a treat. I'm not sure which we liked more, the great food or the wonderful conversation and delightful time with Pepe, his wife and daughter. He kept bringing out samples and extras that just made the experience a perfect evening. We talked about the spices he uses, the places they come from, how it's made. And basically I loved the fact that he told us what we should order. He suggested - and we agreed - to each get something and share the flavor with the other. The anchovy on potato chips was superb. My wife loved the black pudding appetizer. The salmon was great and the entrecote steak so flavorful. Dessert was amazing - flan and rice pudding and he kept showing is unique features and spices to put on it. We loved it when Pepe sat and told us the story about how he started the place 43 years ago and how he's been married 30 years - happy and thriving. It was a perfect evening. Although he may not be able to spend as much time with everyone if the place is full at 9pm, I am sure he loves to meet each person who walks through the door. The value was amazing. His hand-written menu on a piece of spiral paper torn out of a notebook was written especially for English speakers who can't navigate the Spanish. The set price of 12 Euros included everything and it was well worth the bill. The quality and taste was great. But the experience made it a truly unforgettable experience. Not a superficial, glitzy bar. But a true Spanish community place that you'll remember. It's a great place to add to your list of things in Madrid.

title_review: Local cooking at it's best, and excellent service - what more could you ask for?
review_preview: If you are staying over at Barajas waiting for your flight, try this place for a (last?) memory of Spain. We found this by accident but it's close to Hotels such as Ibis and Clemente. Dining room was nearly full with locals so we chose...
review_full: If you are staying over at Barajas waiting for your flight, try this place for a (last?) memory of Spain. We found this by accident but it's close to Hotels such as Ibis and Clemente. Dining room was nearly full with locals so we chose the tables by the bar, and a very welcoming host (Pepe) soon had a menu (in English) and some suggestions for us. We took his advice and were not disappointed. Tapas of the day - mussels topped with onions, celery and tomato, plus a few slices of very good Jamon carved off the bone before us. Tried the potato omelette, meat balls in potato sauce, fried 'shark', some roasted peppers and a couple of glasses of wine - 22Euro and more than we could eat. Even so Pepe insisted on a small dessert of chocolate coated ice cream, complimentary and an excellent finish to the meal. Ambience is 'local' but the bar side is great fun - comings and goings, busy staff (Pepe was every where). Recommended.

Pepe is an engaging fellow who wants you to taste his food and will accommodate your interests by delivering samples of items. I loved the meatballs and calamari and little treats continued to be provided across my meal. There is a patio with umbrellas at which you can sit and enjoy the sun and it isn't noisy as there is a hedge around the cafe which gives privacy. While many restaurants near airport locations tend to be pricey and not terribly good, this one is reasonable and very good and Pepe seems genuinely interested in his international guests. The Barajas district is safe and not unpleasant to walk around in this area. I was given a chocolate ice cream sample to complete my meal for which I was not expecting but was kindly issued. Thank you Pepe and family!

review_preview: Staying at hotel near airport to fly out early next morning, this was a short walk away. A solid, family run restaurant, the ambiance was enhanced by the fact that Spain was playing a World Cup match during our visit. Pepe prepared a potent Sangria...
review_full: Staying at hotel near airport to fly out early next morning, this was a short walk away. A solid, family run restaurant, the ambiance was enhanced by the fact that Spain was playing a World Cup match during our visit. Pepe prepared a potent Sangria at our table, emphasizing the fact that no ice should be added, lest the potency be diluted. Instead, a frosty decanter and frosty mugs were utilized to achieve the chill. The food was of the average high quality were experienced throughout Spain, albeit at very modest prices. Pepe even threw in a plate of complimentary snails, and a glass of post-dessert port to finish off the meal. Overall, a highly recommended experience.

We will come back to this restaurant next October after the Camino.

title_review: The restaurant Masterchef didn't dare to mess with
review_preview: I've got this friend who thinks that Masterchef and the current trend of cooking shows and books is just messing with the stuff that was already good just because it wasn't fancy enough.Campanillas is a gem of a place that Masterchef and its cohorts...
review_full: I've got this friend who thinks that Masterchef and the current trend of cooking shows and books is just messing with the stuff that was already good just because it wasn't fancy enough. Campanillas is a gem of a place that Masterchef and its cohorts haven't got to yet, the tapas are plain but tasty, with the checkered white and red paper tablecloths and even the waiter was pure old Madrid in a way that you could imagine him in an old early 20th century cafe serving the intelligentsia.  And although the current clientele is not the intelligentsia it's certainly another of the points of going to this restaurant, the array of characters it's stray out of that working class that at times seems not to be in existence anymore. At all rates, pay a visit before it disappears because places like this one won't be here for long.

title_review: Good food, excellent value, friendly service
review_preview: My wife and I ate here during a wait for a flight. We read the reviews, and weren't disappointed. The menu of the day, for a princely €11 was tasty with excellent portions. This is excellent quality local cuisine. Living in Tenerife as we do,...
review_full: My wife and I ate here during a wait for a flight. We read the reviews, and weren't disappointed. The menu of the day, for a princely €11 was tasty with excellent portions. This is excellent quality local cuisine. Living in Tenerife as we do, we are used to good inexpensive food, and eating here was a great experience. Pepe even gave us a memento of Madrid. The service is friendly and quick if you're in a hurry. We weren't and so could take our time. Well worth the one stop metro ride to Barajas station, and then a five minute walk.

title_review: One of our best restaurant experiences...ever!
review_preview: From the moment you walk in, owner Pepe is the captain and takes you under his wing, creating a unique and fun dining experience. The food is excellent and Pepe stopped by our table numerous times to chat and talk food. He brought us a...
review_full: From the moment you walk in, owner Pepe is the captain and takes you under his wing, creating a unique and fun dining experience. The food is excellent and Pepe stopped by our table numerous times to chat and talk food. He brought us a free appetizer and made a killer sangria at our table, then shared the recipe with us and gave us a number of sangria making tips. We then split a large dish of calamari, chicken croquettes and patatas with a hot sauce and aioli, delicious! Afterwards he brought us a small plate of chocolate cookie dough balls (I think that’s what they were...), then made us a complimentary barriquito, which is a unique and delicious liqour coffee drink from the Canary Islands. The food was great, but it’s passionate Pepe puts Campanillas over the top!

review_preview: You won't want to go way WAY out of your ordinary travel path. But my wife & I stayed at the nearby (five minutes walk away) Hotel Täch, before a next day departure for San Francisco. We spotted this place (thanks in part to Trip...
review_full: You won't want to go way WAY out of your ordinary travel path. But my wife & I stayed at the nearby (five minutes walk away) Hotel Täch, before a next day departure for San Francisco. We spotted this place (thanks in part to Trip Advisor), and went there for an early dinner ... 8:30-ish instead of 10-ish, since we had to be up the next morning early. And it was just great. Pepe and wife Carmen run a fine place, with excellent food (some of the best croquetas we had in Spain), and the owners were excellent company, until around 9 pm, when the neighborhood began to occupy all the tables outside. There are great stories to be told about this place; Pepe doesn't speak a lot of English, but he's trying, and the photograph above the bar is of his father, who raised mules & used them to deliver farm produce in the 1910s to the main market in Madrid (Barajas was then a suburb of slowly developing Madrid). They've been in this spot since the late 1960s: the food, the stories, the warmth and friendliness of the proprietors and the neighborhood -- all huge pluses. Give it a try; you won't regret it.

title_review: Best meal in Madrid, hands down! You MUST eat here!
review_preview: A Swedish chef specialising in Thai cuisine serving in Spain. You wouldn't think that combination could make magic, but this place is truly INCREDIBLE! We were lucky enough to find this place as it's a bit tucked away and requires some searching, but it is...
review_full: A Swedish chef specialising in Thai cuisine serving in Spain. You wouldn't think that combination could make magic, but this place is truly INCREDIBLE! We were lucky enough to find this place as it's a bit tucked away and requires some searching, but it is an absolute gem of a restaurant.  To start, the decor is chic without being pretentious and blends the comfortable culture of Madrid with the practicality and edginess of Asian island cultures. The bar tender whips up a mean Pisco Sour that shouldn't be missed and is a great way to start what is about to be an incredible journey of the tastebuds. We went all out and ordered several dishes. We started with the Chipirones de Anzuelo, which come in a perfectly battered panko crust. We then had what was our absolute favourite dish of the evening - the Bao de Panceta (or Pan Bao). They suggest you eat it shortly after ordering as the bread is fresh from the oven and the insanely tender pork absolutely melts in your mouth. Honestly, you could go here to order this dish at least three times. The palm sugar based sauce is also part of the magic to this dish. We followed with the Carrillera de Turner and the Presa de Ibérico. Both full of incredibly unique flavours that mix the best of Thai and Spanish cuisines. For dessert we ordered the Chef's "mess", which included a beautiful assortment of fresh berries, citrus, sorbet, and ice cream. Though it does end up looking like a huge mess of tasty treats when all is said and done, when delivered to your table it's almost too beautiful to eat. Almost being the key word, of course. You simply can't miss this place on your visit to Madrid. The chef is a genius and the flavours are some of the most incredible. we've tasted to date. From top to bottom this restaurant is one of the best we've ever had the pleasure of visiting. Make sure to go out of your way to do the same!

title_review: Best Meal we’ve had in Madrid !!
review_preview: Don’t be fooled by the external appearance of this restaurant - there is a much larger area in the rear section of the restaurant. Both the front & the rear section of the restaurant are nicely decorated, very clean and appealing.As many people have...
review_full: Don’t be fooled by the external appearance of this restaurant - there is a much larger area in the rear section of the restaurant. Both the front & the rear section of the restaurant are nicely decorated, very clean and appealing. As many people have pointed out, the fried plantains served with salsa and guacamole are incredible ! They have a nice selection of Spanish beers, and a decent selection of wines. My wife had a nice vino blanco and I had a Spanish beer from the tap. Since we had already embarked on the Tapas route, our next dish was nachos, covered in cheese and salsa. Nicely done, and went with my beer very nicely!! Our final dish was the prawns in garlic sauce and they were also exquisite ! The sauce was awesome and the prawns were obviously fresh.  Our servers spoke excellent English, and were very helpful in helping us order. We did not have dessert, as we had other plans, but as we heard our server offering another party dessert, we wondered if we had made a bad decision? Do yourself a favor, if you are ever in Madrid, try this restaurant and you will become a fan as we have become !

review_preview: Me and my fiancée saw great reviews of this place on TripAdvisor. We were very surprised once we arrived to the restaurant as it is very small (3 normal low tables close to each other, about 2 high tables and a window bar) so its...
review_full: Me and my fiancée saw great reviews of this place on TripAdvisor. We were very surprised once we arrived to the restaurant as it is very small (3 normal low tables close to each other, about 2 high tables and a window bar) so its quite cramped and not very intimate. This was the front of the restaurant however there may be more seating in the back that we did not notice.  The ambiance is nice and chilled, staff were young gentlemen who took utmost care of the customers ensuring all was going well and recommending different dishes. Was a homey and friendly feeling. The food was delicious, we had the some arepas that cane with four dips (definitely take), then a three layered arrepa and a traditional large arepa filled with meat and cheese (not on menu was recommended). The last was the pulpo which was out of this world, definitely do not miss it!  We ordered a jar of sangria which they make from scrach and have a personal secret touch which is delicious, you can taste its freshly made. Overall great food and service, I hope they one day expand to a larger space and better location. But definitely a nice visit for a calm non crowded lunch.

title_review: The sea on the tip of the tongue without, grounded design food.
review_preview: Service is swift and technical. I enjoyed a fino unfiltered and natural, very delicate. Regarding the rest, there is an oyster merengue worth remembering for its layered texture of flavor, a seafood and algae gelatine with shell fish and plancton is indeed like the sea...
review_full: Service is swift and technical. I enjoyed a fino unfiltered and natural, very delicate. Regarding the rest, there is an oyster merengue worth remembering for its layered texture of flavor, a seafood and algae gelatine with shell fish and plancton is indeed like the sea on the tip of the tongue. The sardine on pan tumaca is simple and subtle, a homemade embutido of pork fat aknowledges that mamals exist. The star dish is a fried egg with dwarf shrimps, it walks again the thin line between hearty meat notes and more ethereal marine things. Overall the food and service compensate the clinical hotel vibe, making the Glass Bar a place for food and not another souless corporate Gin Bar. The place is small so do reserve and the price meets the quality of the food, 6 dishes with desert, four glasses of fino and wine around 90€, which is affordable for their high standard.

review_full: This is our second time at Cacao - the last was in March 2018 when my husband and I fell on Cacao and fell in love with the burrata salad and the pulpo - and the people! OMG. You know, it is always risky to return the second time - but Cacao lived up to our expectations. This time we brought our fellow travelers and foodies and the grilled pulpo and the burrata salad did not disappoint any of us, nor did the mushroom risotto: we yearn for more and might have to make a trip back to Madrid to make it visit #3. The family who runs this restobar is so friendly and welcoming - trust me, this is a great experience all the way around! Just do it - the food and the family are not-to-be missed!

title_review: Delicious food, friendly staff, local gem
review_preview: Highly recommend this small, local bar/restaurant. We wanted to avoid touristy places where the food is always a let-down. We succeeded with Cacao Restobar! All the tapas and other dishes were absolutely delicious and just the right size for two to share. They bring them...
review_full: Highly recommend this small, local bar/restaurant. We wanted to avoid touristy places where the food is always a let-down. We succeeded with Cacao Restobar! All the tapas and other dishes were absolutely delicious and just the right size for two to share. They bring them out in stages just when you’re ready for the next one to arrive. Get the mojito, which is made with their own special syrup distilled straight from sugarcane and with an interesting flavor we couldn’t quite pace—maybe some type of spice or pepper. The tres leches cake is the best I’ve ever tasted! The staff is also incredibly friendly and helpful.

review_preview: Recommended by the maître d’ at Cebo, opposite to Glass, in the vestibule of the Urban Hotel.Wow!The experience was superb, from the cozy yet contemporary design fitted with high quality materials, the friendly attentive servers, to the small but outstanding fresh seafood.I...
review_full: Recommended by the maître d’ at Cebo, opposite to Glass, in the vestibule of the Urban Hotel. Wow! The experience was superb, from the cozy yet contemporary design fitted with high quality materials, the friendly attentive servers, to the small but outstanding fresh seafood. I had the grilled octopus (pulpo) starter, which was served in a fresh lettuce wrap, delicately seasoned with a hint of watercress and black roe aioli. The octopus melted on the palate.  That was followed by an equally tender grilled fatty tuna, with finely chopped red onion and hint of ginger. The tuna was served well done but had a silky almost creamy texture - just delightful. Nicely accompanied with a glass of Raimat Abadia D.O. (Cabernet and Tempranillo). Bottled still water arrived after dinner with a small bite of white chocolate praline and a dusted dark chocolate truffle. Delicious!

Smoked octopus tentacle with celeriac purée, and seafarer patacones - hard to describe but fish and prawn pieces on a bed of ?guacomole on toast. We also had pork tenderloin kebabbed with sweet potato crisps and all with interesting sauces. Atmosphere and decor are upbeat and there is a queue of folk trying to get in. Definitely worth the experience

review_preview: I have now been living in Madrid for just over 3 months and have been back to Rosi La Loca 4 times already. There are so many places here but the food is so good I just keep going back. The sharing steak is unbelievable...
review_full: I have now been living in Madrid for just over 3 months and have been back to Rosi La Loca 4 times already. There are so many places here but the food is so good I just keep going back. The sharing steak is unbelievable and ONLY €25! It is served with roasted peppers and onions and homemade wedges. However, I would suggest ordering a side dish (The items on the menu for roughly €7-8) as it is slightly on the small side but incredibly cheap for the quality of meat you get.  I have tried various items off the menu now and can also confirm that the paella is amazing, without a doubt one of the best ones i've had while in Madrid.  The cocktails are also very good, a little pricy but this is very common in the capital city. They are very aesthetically impressive.  Overall, if you are in Madrid even for a night, I would 100% recommend this restaurant. You will not be disappointed.

title_review: BEST Food, BEST Value, and BEST People!   Amazing Dinner in Madrid!
review_preview: We are New Yorkers and have been on vacation for a week in Europe.  We have eaten some terrific meals, but for overall experience our evening tonight at Rosi La Loca Taberna was absolutely the best eating experience of our vacation.   The combination of terrific...
review_full: We are New Yorkers and have been on vacation for a week in Europe. We have eaten some terrific meals, but for overall experience our evening tonight at Rosi La Loca Taberna was absolutely the best eating experience of our vacation. The combination of terrific food at an incredibly reasonable price and the “over the top” warmth and friendliness of the restaurant staff, who truly could not do enough for us, made the dinner more than a meal, it felt like a family experience. From our servers Gloria and Adam, to the manager Alejandro (who spent many years living in New Jersey), to our hostess Eva (who literally went the extra mile to assist us in getting a reservation at a sister restaurant for tomorrow), to Richard (already a Trip Advisor Legend in reviews we had seen prior to booking) - everyone treated us like 10 year regulars instead of like the tourists we were. Their warmth and genuine interest in us, in addition to their excellent service, made the experience memorable.  While being well treated was wonderful, the quality of the food for the price took the experience to another level of enjoyment. We started with burrata infused with a hypodermic filled with olive oil and pesto, in a tomato based immersion. We then had tenderloin of pork with sweet potato chips and applesauce that was perfectly tender and delicious. My wife is not a pork lover, and she found herself wanting more of this delicate dish. The next appetizer was tuna tataki, which was served in a gondola “floating” in dry ice. The tuna was rare and perfectly marinated in soy sauce and Japanese spices, and topped with an aoli cream sauce and sitting on a bed of seaweed. I am a huge tuna lover and I order it in restaurants frequently. This was among the best tuna dishes I have ever eaten. Its excellence required a second order - which was consumed even more quickly than the first.  We then had the chicken and seafood paella, which was served in the Spanish style for 3 - and was plentiful. The rice was done perfectly - neither too “al dente” nor mushy. The sauce was delicious. The seafood and chicken cooked perfectly. It was a treat. All the while, Alejandro, Adam and Gloria were checking in frequently to assure our satisfaction - mostly they heard as “oohing” and “aahing”over the quality of the food. They were accessible without hovering.  Finally, after eating a tremendous amount of excellent food, and very good (and not expensive) wine, it was time for dessert - sadly, we only had room to split one. The brownie with ice cream was like lava cake and disappeared almost upon Gloria placing it on the table. As we went upstairs to pay the check by credit card, we encountered Richard, who also asked about our meal. Feeling like family by now, we told him of the pleasurable evening we were having, and he insisted on providing, on the house, one additional treat. He reached into the fridge and removed limoncello shots in test tube like containers, which we shook and downed.  Having finished an incredible evening, Alejandro told us they had a sister restaurant around the corner, named InClan, and we eagerly agreed to dine there tomorrow. Eva then worked some magic to get us a reservation, again treating us like family. We can;t wait to try InClan tomorrow - if it’s half as good as our overall experience tonight, we’ll be satisfied. I realize in reading such a rave review you might wonder if we were somehow connected to the restaurant. I assure you we are tourists from New York (I have many other reviews on line in TripAdvisor) and have never seen this place or the people who were so incredible before tonight. We thank Gloria, Alejandro, Adam, Richard and the enchanting Eva for making us so very happy not because of the great food, but because we were treated like family. We highly recommend this place - a trip to Madrid won’t be complete without a visit.

title_review: Last stop before heading to rest
review_preview: Glass Mar is the Tapas bar inside the Urban Hotel. The first thing you notice is the Eclectic Decor and trendy ambience. It is very common to have a drink at this place after 2:00 in the morning. Although it is a Seafood snack place...
review_full: Glass Mar is the Tapas bar inside the Urban Hotel. The first thing you notice is the Eclectic Decor and trendy ambience. It is very common to have a drink at this place after 2:00 in the morning. Although it is a Seafood snack place and coffee shop during the whole day, in the evening and until very late it turns into a lively bar where my wife and I used to have our last stop before heading to rest in our room at the Urban. The highlight of the place is it’s staff. You cannot imagine that after 2:00 am and probably close to 3:00 am, they will serve you with a smile in their faces and cheerfully. The bar has an extensive collection of drinks, some of them made by special orders. Come to this nice place just before going to your own places and enjoy the last sip of the evening.

We'll certainly be back when next in Madrid.

Now, this is truly a neighbor bar/restaurant. We walked by it once before we figured out that it was the right one. The waiter was good. We ordered 2 hamburger dishes and a salad. He looked at us and said that the hamburgers are big and that the salads are big. He said we could always have the salad after eating the burgers. He was right, The burgers were cooked perfectly and the fries were cooked perfectly. We had 2 beers, 1 water and the burgers and the total was 22.00 euros. Excellent.

review_full: Visited Bar Selva due to the good reviews on TA and was pleased. When we arrived at 7.15PM we were told they only start dinner service at 7.30PM which wasn't a problem for us. We were then served bread and cold cuts on the house. We ordered 1 appetizer and 2 mains to share between 2 people and were queried if its too much for us. It was a kind gesture by the bartender / waiter but because we only had churros for lunch we were pretty hungry after walking around the city the whole day so we went ahead.  The fried cheese appetizer was delightful. We ordered steak and pork fillets for mains however was served pork ribs and pork fillets so was quite disappointing. However initially I wanted to ordered the ribs as well so was half ok with the mistake. The pork fillet was tender and delicious but the ribs weren't great and dry. Both servings was huge and could see why our order was queried initially.  1 appetizer + 2 mains + 2 beers came to less than 30 Euros.  *Also the menu del dia that many has mentioned previously is only available for lunch.
